children.text: Theme variables represent design properties such as colors, fonts, or spacing. In CSS, these variables are implemented using CSS Custom Properties (aka CSS Variables).
UUI visuals are built on a set of theme variables, with the "Core Variables" group forming the foundation, as described below.
Each theme uses the same set of variables but assigns different values to them. You can switch the theme in header on this site to see how the variables on this page adapt to the selected theme.

These variables are not limited to customizing UUI components. We recommend using them to style your own application components and visual elements. This approach ensures consistency across multiple themes (e.g., light/dark mode), promotes more readable and semantic CSS code, and enables quick adaptation to changes in brand guidelines.
